events.name: San Gabriel Mountains Trailbuilders
events.description: The San Gabriel Mountains Trailbuilders work the 1st, 3rd, and 5th Saturday of every month, and we work special projects which are not scheduled. Please email us to get on to the mailinglist to keep informed about scheduled and special projects! Email Ben atbwootenwhite@hotmail.com

events.name: Rubio Canyon Trail Work
events.description: Beginners welcome. The group meets every other Saturday at 8AM in Altadena. See here for more details https://www.signupgenius.com/go/10c0f4aabae2ba4ffc61-volunteer2

events.name: Trailwork Project with PCTA:  Lake Fire Tread and Brushing
events.description:
10/20/2022 - 10/23/2022

Trail Gorillas: LA Gateway Chapter


More Info and to register, click here: https://connect.pcta.org/volunteer/s/project/a1i7V000004Dh3MQAS/lake-fire-tread-and-brushing


The Lake Fire burned much of the vegetation that holds the soils in place and helps absorb the water along the trail. Water that used to run across the trail now runs down the trail creating ruts. In a few places the vegetation did not burn and it is now infringing on the trail. We will cut this brush back, we will remove slough from the trail, we will remove the ruts and establish the proper slope on the trail so that it sheds the water before it runs down the trail creating these ruts.

You are welcome to volunteer for any day or days that you are available to attend. We will camp at Sawmill Campground. Meals will be provided for campers.

Come enjoy the comradery of the Trail Gorillas and see what a difference you can make on the trail.

events.name: Trailwork Project with PCTA:  Pinyon Flats Brushing & Tread
events.description:
Register here: https://connect.pcta.org/volunteer/s/project/a1i7V000004Dk0QQAS/pinyon-flats-brushing-tread


Project Title
Pinyon Flats Brushing & Tread


Project Leader Info
James Richter trailgorillasoftheanf@gmail.com



Agency/Land Manager Name
Formula pulling the Account Name and defaulting to the Picklist if the Account Lookup is blank. Public facing
Angeles National Forest: San Gabriel Monument RD


Maximum Number of Volunteers
16



Project Description
This is the description that will appear when volunteers are viewing your project on the website. This is your chance to convince volunteers that they should join your project, so be as detailed as possible.
There is thick brush infringing on the trail from Pinyon Flats northbound for two miles. This brush frequently pushes hikers off the trail causing tread damage and trail creep. The Trail Gorillas will be cutting the brush and moving it off the trail and repairing tread where needed. We will be camping at a nearby campground. Meals will be provided starting with the first days evening meal.Come and enjoy making a difference on the PCT and enjoy some Trail Gorillas comradery. You can join us for a day, or multiple days.

Work Details







Elevation
This will auto-fill once you set the location on the map in the "Project Location" tab. After you select a location and press save, you can refresh your page a view the elevation of the selected location.
5,700


Camping Type
Developed Campground



Hiking Miles per Day
How many miles should your crew be prepared to hike for a typical day on this project?
4 maximum


Total Backpacking Miles to Basecamp
On backcountry projects, how many miles must volunteers hike to first basecamp?



Fitness Level Description
Moderate-Difficult. This project is suitable for individuals in good physical condition and participate in a regular exercise routine. Project components will include one or more of the following: hiking 3-8 miles each day, the trail may be rough, steep, and/or rocky, elevation change over 1000 ft over the course of the hike, moderately physical work activities, and/or backpacking. This project may be physically challenging to some people, participants need to be in good physical condition and aware of their physical abilities and limits before joining this project.

events.name: PCTA: Leona Divide Brushing & Tread #1
events.description:
11/12/2022 - 11/15/2022

Trail Gorillas: LA Gateway Chapter


More Info


Brush is infringing on the trail from Spunky Canyon, PCT Mile 471.5, south to the powerlines at mile 468.2. The brush is pushing hikers off the trail causing tread damage and trail creep. There is also significant slough and erosion in this section. The Trail Gorillas will cut the brush and remove it from the trail. We will also repair the tread where needed along this section.


Register Here: https://connect.pcta.org/volunteer/s/project/a1i7V000004Dk0aQAC/leona-divide-brushing-tread-1
